dict.string: To begin, we need to build a max heap. In a max heap, all the parents are greater than or equal to their children.
To build a max heap, the last parent node, which is "2", is targeted. "2" has a child, "8".
Since, "8" is greater than its parent. Swap "8" and "2".
Then, the next parent node is analyzed. This time, "3" is the parent.
"3" has two children "7" and "0".
"7" is the greatest number, so "7" and "3" are swapped.
Again, the next
Then, the root of the heap, which is the greatest number of the heap, is swapped with the last number of the heap.
And, "9" is taken out of the heap, and put back to the list at the last position.
Again, we use max heapify for the new heap.
Now, we analyzed "1". It has two children "5" and "4".
"5" and "1" are swapped.
Then, "1" is swapped with "2".
We have a max heap again.
The root "5" and the last element "1" are swapped.
And, "5" is taken out and inserted back to the list.
The same operations are repeated until all of the numbers are fully sorted
